pros: There was Great work environment
cons: At times it could be Unorganized

review_title: Stay Away from the Cancer Center Officers
job_title: Community Outreach Coordinator in Atlanta, GA
pros: The only pro is working in a college environment.
cons:
The headline speaks for itself. The people they have in these so-called "Officer" positions do nothing but try to dump their work off onto other people and pretend like they're busy when they do ABSOLUTELY nothing. These officers (especially the Chief Development Officer) constantly make excuses for not performing their duties; however, they'll turn around and expect one coordinator to carry the load. When it becomes too much, they'll try to say you're having trouble with "prioritizing" or "time management" and will do nothing to contribute. You can only claim lack of resources, low budget, and "the way things are" for so long...the working conditions should NEVER be that way - and they wouldn't be if the leaders LEAD and do their jobs. I performed two jobs with multiple people to report to on a meager salary. The hypocrisy and lack of respect is palpable.

The "me above you" mentality runs deep here. When you call supervisors out about their behavior & decisions, they'll be quick to pull you from projects (to make it look as if you're not performing everything in your job description), write you up on egregious accusations, and take advantage of the system to make your experience difficult. My job was threatened multiple times due to fallacious claims before they conspired with HR to wrongfully terminate me because I wouldn't play into their hand and HR and my former bosses made up lies to cover their own tracks. 

HR is antiquated & complacent, gives the "runaround" about corrective action, and will flip the script to side with supervisors giving employees unfair treatment. 

Not to mention that this is very little order and structure within this department and they're not doing an adequate job generating or handling funds to the point where they can barely fund their PhD students. The environment is so toxic that there is little trust and unity among staff.

pros:
It provides an opportunity both to develop the intellectual capabilities of young Black students, to mentor young people with potential and send them out to live their best lives.

It provides a real opportunity to develop scholarship in areas that scholars at PWIs mostly don’t care to study but that have substantial meaning for Black people.
cons: The administration has a tendency towards the sclerotic, it treats its employees badly, and its students worse. It has done little to improve working conditions, and it pays its faculty below the already low state average.

review_title: Learn Lead and in Need of Change - CAU
pros:
- The tuition allowance is by far the best benefit of working at Clark Atlanta University.
- Compensation at CAU for an education institution is average. 
-
cons:
- No merit increases in the last several years. 
- Senior leadership tenured and not adapting to innovation. 
- No online course offering. 
- Senior leadership not able to deliver on the strategic vision and planning.

pros: The work environment is family friendly. Co workers are also cordial an mostly professional. Working with young adults on a daily basis is also professionally rewarding.
cons: The major problem is the expensive salary comprehension problem on the academic side, with most recent hires making more money than longstanding employees forvthexsame jobs.

review_title: Do not work for Clark Atlanta University! Looks bad on your resume. You will regret it!
pros: Aside from potentially inspiring students to become great citizens,  job satisfaction sucked at CAU.
cons: The Administration does not care about employees, or the success and progression of CAU. The buildings are outdated, much like the software and equipment needed to perform basic/daily activities. Extraordinary performance goes unnoticed, without any prospect of getting a salary increase/bonus. There is not consideration for new role assignments within a department or other areas. Policies are outdated, and not fully exercised by majority of staff.

pros: Location, Resume Booster, and You can Receive Good References
cons: Doesn't always value the hard work staff and faculty do to maintain the historic name of CAU.

review_title: Great place to grow & gain experience!
pros: Flexible shift, great co-workers, and opportunities for advancement. It was a good environment to learn more about higher education administration.
cons: The salary was low and there is high-turnover. There can be a perception of work-place cliques and the in-crowd. Stay professional at all times!

pros: The people and the students
cons:
Extremely political environment.  Individuals not promoted based on contributions but promoted based on having their nose in the right person's face.

Senior Management, Executive level management.

If you're getting  a job here, get your money UP FRONT.  Don't expect any promotions or raises unless you're a tried and true brown noser.  You've been duly warned..................

pros: Most of the people have the best interest of the students in mind.
cons: Most of the processes are broken.

pros: The campus is nice. The technology in the classrooms is modern and current. The students are excited about campus life.
cons: The faculty is old, poorly trained, and lacking basic technical understanding. The University as a whole is lacking in funds to maintain the current infrastructure, much less purchase new technology. There is a general lack of vision, leadership and accountability. The students are spoiled, lazy and lack respect for the faculty.

pros: the work-life balance, being able to go to class and still work a few hours during school hours was great!
